title: 2-year-old injured in shooting at Madison apartment
content:
MADISON, TN (WSMV) -
A 2-year-old child was critically injured in a shooting inside a Madison apartment on Tuesday.
Police said Kendal Pinkerton was critically injured in the shooting at the Charter Village Apartments in the 300 block of Rio Vista Drive. The girl was transported to the Children's Hospital at Vanderbilt.
Police said it appeared the shooting was accidental, but an hour later, they were taking pictures, documenting tattoos and processing tests.
In all, two women went through this drill and one man was taken straight to an unmarked car and taken away.
Metro detectives are interviewing several people in the apartment to determine what happened. One detective told Channel 4 that witnesses weren't giving them much to work with.
Neighbors were upset when they heard the news.
"My daughter called me and told me someone had been shot, a child had been shot," said Patricia Henderson, a neighbor. "It made me rush to get my grandbabies to make sure everybody's safe."
There are currently no charges in this shooting. Police said it remains under investigation.
